Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: PRESSURE OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequence number uniquely identifying theproduction test being performed in the well.
Column Comment.3: ABSOLUTE OPEN FLOW OBSERVATION NUMBER: A number identifying theabsolute open flow (AOF) pressure observation.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: ANALYSIS TYPE: identifies the type of Absolute Open Flow procedure. For example,Simplified or Lit procedure.
Column Comment.6: ABSOLUTE OPEN FLOW CALCULATION METHOD: The method used to calculatethe absolute open flow potential of the well. Entries could include single point,multi-point, theoretical, or incomplete data.
Column Comment.7: ABSOLUTE OPEN FLOW POTENTIAL: Calculated open flow potential. Thetheoretical rate that a well would flow at the wall of the well with zero poundspressure.
Column Comment.8: ABSOLUTE OPEN FLOW POTENTIAL OUOM: Absolute open flow potential originalunit of measure.
Column Comment.9: ABSOLUTE OPEN FLOW SLOPE: The slope of the stabilized deliverability line. Thepoints of the 4pt test are plotted and the slope determines optimum flow rate.
Column Comment.10: BOTTOM HOLE PRESSURE METHOD: The bottom hole pressure method indicatesif the bottom hole pressures were directly measured downhole or measured atsurface and recalculated to the downhole setting.
Column Comment.11: CALCULATED ABSOLUTE OPEN FLOW RATE: The calculated absolute open flowbased on a productivity test. The theoretical maximum producing capacity of a gaswell.
Column Comment.12: CALCULATED ABSOLUTE OPEN FLOW RATE OUOM: Calculated open flow(production test) original unit of measure.
Column Comment.13: CHOKE SIZE DESCRIPTION: A narrative description of the choke size (e.g., 7 1/2inches).
Column Comment.14: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.15: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.16: FLOW PERIOD DURATION: The duration of the absolute open flow period.
Column Comment.17: FLOW PERIOD DURATION OUOM: Flow period duration original unit of measure.
Column Comment.18: FLOW PRESSURE: The sandface pressure at the stabilized flow rate.
Column Comment.19: FLOW PRESSURE OUOM: Flow pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.20: FLOW RATE: The stabilized flow rate for the test.
Column Comment.21: FLOW RATE OUOM: Flow rate original unit of measure.
Column Comment.22: FOUR POINT CALCULATED ABSOLUTE OPEN FLOW RATE: The calculatedabsolute open flow rate based on a 4 point test.
Column Comment.23: FOUR POINT CALCULATED ABSOLUTE OPEN FLOW RATE OUOM: Calculatedopen flow (four point test) original unit of measure.
Column Comment.24: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.25: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.26: RESERVOIR PRESSURE: The average reservoir pressure. This is the shutinpressure for a four point test and referred to as formation/reservoir pressure.
Column Comment.27: RESERVOIR PRESSURE OUOM: Reservoir pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.28: SHUTIN PRESSURE TYPE: This reference table defines the type of shutin pressurebeing measured. For example, Tubing pressure, Casing pressure or Bottom Holepressure.
Column Comment.29: TEST DATE: Date the absolute open flow (AOF) or four point test was performed.
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
